about.name: Dubrovnik
about.info_text: Dubrovnik, often referred to as the 'Pearl of the Adriatic,' is a historic coastal city located in the southern part of Croatia. Known for its well-preserved medieval walls, stunning Old Town, and crystal-clear waters of the Adriatic Sea, Dubrovnik is a popular tourist destination. The city is rich in history and culture, with a blend of architectural marvels, beautiful beaches, and a vibrant culinary scene. Visitors can explore the city's ancient streets, historic landmarks, and enjoy the picturesque views from the city walls.
about.facts_text:
Population: Approximately 42,000
County: Dubrovnik-Neretva
Time Zone: Central European Time (UTC+01:00)
Language: Croatian
Currency: Croatian Kuna (HRK)
about.climate_text: Dubrovnik has a Mediterranean climate with hot, dry summers and mild, wet winters. Summers are ideal for beach visits, while the shoulder seasons provide pleasant weather for exploring the city.

attractions_card.title: Dubrovnik City Walls
attractions_card.description: The Dubrovnik City Walls are a UNESCO World Heritage site and offer a scenic walk around the Old Town, providing panoramic views of the city and the sea.

attractions_card.title: Old Town (Stari Grad)
attractions_card.description: Dubrovnik's Old Town is a well-preserved medieval city center with narrow streets, historic buildings, and landmarks like the Sponza Palace and Rector's Palace.

attractions_card.title: Stradun (Placa)
attractions_card.description: Stradun is the main street of Dubrovnik's Old Town, lined with cafes, shops, and historic architecture. It's the heart of the city's social and cultural life.

attractions_card.title: Dubrovnik Cathedral
attractions_card.description: The Dubrovnik Cathedral is a magnificent Baroque-style cathedral with impressive artwork, including Titian's 'Assumption of Mary.'

attractions_card.title: Lokrum Island
attractions_card.description: Lokrum Island, a short ferry ride from Dubrovnik, is a nature reserve with lush gardens, monasteries, and a saltwater lake ideal for swimming.

attractions_card.title: Mount Srd
attractions_card.description: Mount Srd offers stunning views of Dubrovnik and the Adriatic Sea. Visitors can reach the summit by cable car or hike to the top.

attractions_card.title: Banje Beach
attractions_card.description: Banje Beach is a popular pebble beach near the Old Town, offering clear waters for swimming and a beach club with panoramic views.

attractions_card.title: Fort Lovrijenac
attractions_card.description: Fort Lovrijenac, also known as 'St. Lawrence Fortress,' is an impressive fortress outside the city walls, offering great views and serving as a venue for the Dubrovnik Summer Festival.

food_card.title: Seafood Risotto
food_card.description: Seafood risotto is a local delicacy in Dubrovnik, featuring fresh Adriatic seafood, Arborio rice, white wine, and aromatic herbs.

food_card.title: Black Squid Ink Risotto
food_card.description: Black squid ink risotto is a unique and delicious dish, known for its deep black color and rich seafood flavor.

food_card.title: Pasticada
food_card.description: Pasticada is a traditional Dalmatian dish made with slow-cooked beef, often marinated in red wine and aromatic spices, served with gnocchi or potatoes.

food_card.title: Octopus Salad
food_card.description: Octopus salad is a refreshing and light appetizer or meal, made with tender octopus, fresh vegetables, olive oil, and herbs.

food_card.title: Rozata
food_card.description: Rozata is a traditional Croatian dessert, similar to flan, with caramelized sugar and a smooth custard filling.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Excelsior Dubrovnik
hotels_card.description: Hotel Excelsior offers luxurious accommodations with stunning sea views, a private beach, and proximity to the Old Town.

hotels_card.title: Hotel Dubrovnik Palace
hotels_card.description: Hotel Dubrovnik Palace is a modern and elegant hotel situated on the Lapad Peninsula, offering sea-facing rooms, a spa, and multiple dining options.

hotels_card.title: Hilton Imperial Dubrovnik
hotels_card.description: Hilton Imperial Dubrovnik is a historic hotel located near the Old Town, providing comfortable rooms and access to the beach.

hotels_card.title: Villa Dubrovnik
hotels_card.description: Villa Dubrovnik is a boutique hotel with breathtaking sea views, private beaches, and a tranquil atmosphere.

hotels_card.title: Valamar Argosy Hotel
hotels_card.description: Valamar Argosy Hotel offers comfortable accommodations on the Babin Kuk peninsula, with access to beautiful beaches and numerous amenities.

transport_card.title: Dubrovnik Airport
transport_card.description: Dubrovnik Airport (DBV) is the primary international gateway to the city, located approximately 15.5 kilometers from the Old Town.

transport_card.title: Public Buses
transport_card.description: Dubrovnik has an efficient public bus system that connects various parts of the city, including the Old Town and surrounding areas.

transport_card.title: Dubrovnik Port
transport_card.description: Dubrovnik Port serves as a transportation hub for ferries and cruise ships, providing access to nearby islands and coastal destinations.

transport_card.title: Taxi Services
transport_card.description: Taxis are readily available in Dubrovnik and are a convenient way to get around the city and explore nearby areas.
